etymologies: early 18th century (in an earlier sense). From rice + bird

definitions: The bobolink, Dolichonyx oryzivorus, flocks of which often frequent rice fields while on migration. Compare "rice bunting", reed-bird.
Any of various other birds, especially songbirds, (supposedly) found in rice fields.

notes.text: Formerly frequently as an item of food, as were bobolinks.

definitions: The Java sparrow, Padda oryzivora (family Estrildidae), which frequents rice fields in Asia and is popular as a cage bird.
